articles.title: Foreign Ministers of 26 Nations Demand Israel Restore Humanitarian Aid to Gaza
articles.description: Top diplomats from 26 nations, including many U.S. allies, are calling for urgent action to end Israel’s siege of Gaza. They demand Israel restore large-scale access for U.N. and international humanitarian aid groups, open border crossings into Gaza, and cease lethal force against civilians seeking food at aid distribution sites.

articles.title: Trump Deploys National Guard to D.C.—Power Grab or Public Safety?
articles.description: President Donald Trump announced the deployment of the National Guard to Washington, D.C., and assumed control of the city's police force. This move has sparked debate over whether it signifies creeping authoritarianism or is a legitimate measure to combat crime in the nation's capital.

articles.title: Sudan’s Rapid Support Forces Kill 40 in Camp for Displaced People in Darfur
articles.description: In Sudan, at least 40 civilians have been killed in an attack by Rapid Support Forces on a camp sheltering displaced people in Darfur. The attack involved storming the Abu Shouk camp, opening fire on homes, and executing civilians. This incident coincides with a cholera outbreak in displacement camps across Darfur.
